comments:
While I was trying to import a large C++ project into Eclipse, I got the 
following exception. Using Eclipse 2.1.2, CDT 1.2, Linux OS.
Here is the uname -a output from Linux:
    Linux linus 2.4.7-10smp #1 SMP Thu Sep 6 17:09:31 EDT 2001 i686 unknown

Here is what I did:
 a) create a new project
 b) file -> import -> file system
 c) specified a directory to import (clearcase directory)

Here is the java exception I got:

I am sorry. the CDT version is 1.2.1

Please either provide a source file so I can reproduce the problem, or try to 
reproduce this using a 2.0 build, so I can get a sense as to whether or not 
this problem exists in the HEAD of CVS.  

Thanks

Siva, 

Can you verify to me whether or not this problem still exists in CDT 2.0.  We 
are not looking at patching 1.2.1 any further, since our 2.0 release is within 
90 days or so ...

CDT M9 is now available as an update site and a collection of zips. Check 
out the build page at:

        http://update.eclipse.org/tools/cdt/updates/builds/2.0M9

If the problem still exists in 2.0M9, then please let me know and I'll set the 
Target Milestone to 2.0.

I am closing this defect as this is impossible to reproduce with the 
information provided. (I will (re) open it if the reporter can reproduce on the 
2.0 stream, or provide additional info to help guide us on 1.2.1.)
